p: In 2014, Higashi first reported Mg(BH 4)(NH 2) as a new class of solid-state Mg ion conductor (Higashi et al., 2014). The diffusion of Mg ions in Mg(BH 4)(NH 2) was attributed to the Mg zigzag chain and tunneling structures in the a and b planes. It showed the ionic conductivity of 10 −6 S cm −1 at 150°C and the electrochemical window of ~3 V in estimation.
